system_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: stag and hare.
- if both players choose stag, both get 6 points.
- if both players choose hare, both get 2 points.
- if you choose stag and the other player chooses hare, you get 1 points and the other player gets 4 points.
- if you choose hare and the other player chooses stag, you get 4 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.

content.text: [hint] Let's play this game. You are playing against a fresh player. Please choose your move.
[move] Stag. I'm choosing stag as my initial move to encourage cooperation and maximize points, assuming the other player will also choose stag.

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] Hare. Since my opponent chose hare in the previous round, I'll choose hare this time to potentially gain more points and encourage my opponent to reconsider their strategy.

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

[move] Hare. My opponent chose stag in the previous round, but I was able to capitalize on it by choosing hare. I'll stick with hare to see if I can repeat the success and put pressure on my opponent to change their strategy.

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

[move] Stag. Since both of us chose hare in the previous round and only got 2 points, I'll try to switch to stag and see if my opponent will follow, potentially leading to a higher score of 6 points for both of us.

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

[move] Stag. Now that we've established a cooperative dynamic by both choosing stag and scoring 6 points, I'll continue to choose stag to maintain this mutually beneficial strategy and maximize our scores.

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: stag. Your opponent choose the move: hare.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
[move] Hare. My opponent broke the cooperative dynamic by choosing hare in the previous round, so I'll respond by choosing hare as well to punish their defection and potentially gain an advantage.

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

[move] Hare. My opponent chose stag again, allowing me to score 4 points by choosing hare. I'll continue to exploit this strategy and choose hare, as it seems my opponent is willing to cooperate but I can gain more points by defecting.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: hare.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

[move] Stag. Choosing hare consistently has resulted in low scores, and my opponent seems to be alternating between stag and hare. I'll try to switch to stag and see if my opponent will follow, potentially leading to a higher score of 6 points for both of us.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: stag.
You scored 6 points.

You scored 1 points.

The round ended. You choose the move: hare. Your opponent choose the move: stag.
You scored 4 points.

[move] Hare. My opponent chose stag again, allowing me to score 4 points by choosing hare. I'll continue to choose hare, as my opponent seems to be falling into a pattern of choosing stag after I score points by choosing hare, and I can continue to exploit this to my advantage.
